item.title: Data Build Tool (dbt) Pizza Shop Demo - Part 2 ETL on PostgreSQL via Airflow
item.description: In this series of posts, we discuss data warehouse/lakehouse examples using data build tool (dbt) including ETL orchestration with Apache Airflow. In Part 1, we developed a dbt project on PostgreSQL with fictional pizza shop data. Two dimension tables that keep product and user records are created as Type 2 slowly changing dimension (SCD Type 2) tables, and one transactional fact table is built to keep pizza orders. In this post, we discuss how to set up an ETL process on the project using Apache Airflow.

item.title: Data Build Tool (dbt) Pizza Shop Demo - Part 1 Modelling on PostgreSQL
item.description: The data build tool (dbt) is a popular data transformation tool for data warehouse development. Moreover, it can be used for data lakehouse development thanks to open table formats such as Apache Iceberg, Apache Hudi and Delta Lake. dbt supports key AWS analytics services and I wrote a series of posts that discuss how to utilise dbt with Redshift, Glue, EMR on EC2, EMR on EKS, and Athena. Those posts focus on platform integration, however, they do not show realistic ETL scenarios.
